WorkPlace.Name: FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark ApS
WorkPlace.OrganizationDescription: Biogen Idec creates new standards of care in therapeutic areas with high unmet medical needs. Founded in 1978, Biogen Idec is a global leader in the discovery, development, manufacturing and commercialization of innovative therapies. Patients in more than 90 countries benefit from Biogen Idec's significant products that address diseases such as multiple sclerosis (MS), lymphoma and rheumatoid arthritis. In 2007, Biogen Idec's total revenues grew 18 percent over 2006 to almost $3.2 billion.

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
The company

Fujifilm Diosynth Biotechnologies is a company on the journey to become the leading and most trusted global Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization partner in the biopharmaceutical industry. A great opportunity to accelerate your career and join a great company.

Digital Technologies is a fast-growing department responsible for driving the digital transformation for the site. You will be surrounded by highly dedicated and skilled colleagues who all works on the mission of ensuring stable, efficient and compliant IT solutions. Simplicity and agility are important in everything we do.

The Job – Infrastructure Engineer with Active Directory main responsibility

We are looking for an engaging and energetic infrastructure engineer to join our company, where your primary responsibility will be Active Directory services.  You will be joining an Infrastructure team on a transformation journey to help deliver new and exciting technologies to a (very) fast growing company.  You will have the opportunity to work with both traditional enterprise infrastructure and mission critical systems in support of our manufacturing processes, ensuring a highly available (24/7) enterprise infrastructure.  You will join a team responsible for the implementation for core infrastructure platforms and you will be an integral part of day-to-day operations.  As part of the Infrastructure team, you will be supporting numerous internal projects to mature infrastructure and security services, while also supporting the business with a very busy growth roadmap globally.   

Come join a relatively small team where we collaborate and strive to create a work environment with many opportunities to both have professional growth and a collaborative and productive work atmosphere.  While you can expect to have busy days in a fast-paced environment, we aim to build one of the best places to work with focus on employee development and work-life balance.    

You can expect to work across numerous technologies and initiatives, such as:   

  • Exciting projects in support of plant expansions, including M&A activities and greenfield implementations.
  • Shape the future of our infrastructure and security capabilities with exciting initiatives around:
    • Microsoft Active Directory
    • Azure AD Consolidation project
    • Microsoft Tiered AD structure
    • IAM and MFA/SSO
    • Develop cloud services and capabilities
  • Continuous improvement of existing processes in support of an evolving platform services operations practice.

We are looking for an individual with existing experience within Active Directory management, and ideally a few of the below technologies.  We fully appreciate individuals with the right mindset to learn and take on new challenges/technologies to get the job done. 

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree, or relevant work experience.
  • 5+ years with infrastructure management
  • Strong foundational skills across DNS, DHCP, Microsoft Active directory , Windows server troubleshooting, and GPO management - MSFT Tiered model a plus
  • General knowledge on various virtualization platforms such as VMware Hyper V ,HCI
  • Knowledge around SCCM, patch processes, server/endpoint management, PKI and Certificate management, and Powershell will be a plus but not required
  • Ability to prioritize and work autonomously based on common goals and objectives
  • You have a strong analytical mind, eye for detail and problem-solving skills. You have a natural drive for automation and simplification
  • Quality minded
  • High sense of responsibility
  • Strong English communication skills and solid team player.
  • Experience from the Life Sciences industry is ideal but not required.

Your Application

 

Please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible:

https://fujifilmdiosynth.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/External/details/Infrastructure-Engineer_JR1212

 

About FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

Our site in Hillerød, Denmark, brings together expertise, capabilities and technologies to manufacture advanced biologics. The large scale manufacturing facility has a capacity of 120,000 liters to reliably manufacture biologics for late phase and commercial use. We commenced 6 billion DKK projects to double our manufacturing capacity and to add fill finish to the site.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

As we continue to enhance and expand our capabilities, we are looking for people who share our passion, drive, and energy – what we call Genki – to join our team.

www.fujifilmdiosynth.com
